display1.description: Display styles are used for large, attention-grabbing text, typically in hero sections, landing pages, or promotional contexts. They emphasize hierarchy and visual impact. Font size: 40 - 40 - 72 - 120

display2.description: Display styles are used for large, attention-grabbing text, typically in hero sections, landing pages, or promotional contexts. They emphasize hierarchy and visual impact. Font size: 36 - 36 - 42 - 64

display3.description: Display styles are used for large, attention-grabbing text, typically in hero sections, landing pages, or promotional contexts. They emphasize hierarchy and visual impact. Font size: 28 - 28 - 32 - 40

headline1.description: Headlines structure content into clear sections. They are prominent but more versatile than Display styles, used across articles, teasers and modules. Font size: 48 - 48 - 72 - 100

headline2.description: Headlines structure content into clear sections. They are prominent but more versatile than Display styles, used across articles, teasers and modules. This text style's token for the font size parameter changes across device sizes as follows: 40 - 40 - 48 - 64

headline3.description: Headlines structure content into clear sections. They are prominent but more versatile than Display styles, used across articles, teasers and modules. This text style's font size parameter is controlled by the headline3FontSize token: 28 - 28 - 36 - 40

headline4.description: Headlines structure content into clear sections. They are prominent but more versatile than Display styles, used across articles, teasers and modules. Font size: 22 - 22 - 26 - 32

subheadline1.description: This Subheadlines text style is used in articles. They are placed under the headline at the top of an article. Subheadlines can appear in some teasers also. Font size: 24 - 24 - 32 - 36

kicker1.description: Kickers are short introductory lines placed above a headline to provide context, category, or emphasis. They support content orientation. Font size: 18 - 18 - 22 - 30 --//*//-- currently css uses kicker0 for the naming of this text style and sequence of font size changes

kicker2.description: Kickers are short introductory lines placed above a headline to provide context, category, or emphasis. They support content orientation. Font size: 18 - 18 - 22 - 24 --//*//-- currently css uses kicker1 for the naming of this text style and sequence of font size changes

kicker3.description: Kickers are short introductory lines placed above a headline to provide context, category, or emphasis. They support content orientation. Font size: 16 - 16 - 18 - 20 --//*//-- currently css uses kicker2 for the naming of this text style and sequence of font size changes

kicker4.description: Kickers are short introductory lines placed above a headline to provide context, category, or emphasis. They support content orientation. Font size: 14 - 14 - 16 - 16 --//*//-- currently css uses kicker3 for the naming of this text style and sequence of font size changes

title1.description: Title styles are mid-level headings, often used for module names, card headers, or section labels. They balance prominence with readability. Font size: 22 - 22 - 22 - 28

title1Uppercase.description: Title styles are mid-level headings, often used for module names, card headers, or section labels. They balance prominence with readability. Font size: 22 - 22 - 22 - 28

title2.description:

In the previous system, this style was named Caption. For greater clarity and consistency, it has been renamed to title2. Font size: 16 - 16 - 18 - 20

title2Uppercase.description:

callout.description: Callouts highlight key information, quotes, or important notes inside content. They stand apart from body text to draw attention. There is overlap between this text style and the title text styles. Font size: 18 - 18 - 22 - 22

body.description: Body styles are the default for running text. They prioritize readability and are optimized for long-form content across devices. Font size remains constant at 21 across device sizes.

bodyItalic.description: Body styles are the default for running text. They prioritize readability and are optimized for long-form content across devices. Font size remains constant at 21 across device sizes.

bodyBold.description: Body styles are the default for running text. They prioritize readability and are optimized for long-form content across devices. Font size remains constant at 21 across device sizes.

bodyBoldItalic.description: Body styles are the default for running text. They prioritize readability and are optimized for long-form content across devices. Font size remains constant at 21 across device sizes.

textLink.description: Use this text style for styling elements that are clickable text links inside body texts. This style is often found in article texts. Font size remains constant at 21 across device sizes.

textLinkItalic.description: Use this text style for styling elements that are clickable text links inside body texts that are using the italic style. This style is often found in article texts that need to show contrast for publications titles, specific words or names. Font size remains constant at 21 across device sizes.

textLinkBold.description: Use this text style for styling elements that are clickable text links inside emphasized body texts that are using the bold or html strong style. This style is often found in article texts that need to show contrast for specific words or names. Font size remains constant at 21 across device sizes.

textLinkHover.description: Use this style for body text links or other text links that are in active state. Font size remains constant at 21 across device sizes.

textLinkBoldHover.description: Use this style for body text links or other text links that are in active state. Font size remains constant at 21 across device sizes.

This specific style is commonly used on small two lines of text that are seen on standard teasers. The font size of this text style is similar to the label text style. This text style should be chosen when longer small descriptive texts in a small font size is needed where as the label text style should be used for shorter identifier texts. Font size: 16 - 16 - 16 - 18

liveTickerBandButtonGradient.description: This gradient it used on the edges of the live ticker slider component that contains short headlines along with a timestamp. The gradient shows up on the left and right edges of the component to indicate that more content can be viewed if the headline elements are scrolled horizontally.

liveTickerMoreContentGradient.description: This gradient it used on the edges of the live ticker slider component that contains short headlines along with a timestamp. appTopbarTabsTitle.description: iOS and Android apps currently have a top bar with tabs that when selected display different content within the main view of the device. tableEdgeShadow.description: This gradient is used on the inner edges of table components. It creates a subtle shadow for indicating that more content is available if the table content is scrolled horizontally.

teaserTitlesBgGradient.description: This gradient is used behind teaser headlines. It is overlayed on top of the teaser image. It creates a darker background for white headlines to have better contrast against image backgrounds.

articleTimeStamp.description: Use this text style for time and day text string that commonly shows up along with the article authors avatars. Font size: 12 - 12 - 14 - 16

audioPlayerLabel.description: This text style is used on audio player labels for elapsed time, reproduction speed and short functionality description text. Font size: 16 - 16 - 16 - 18

videoTimeBadge.description: This text style is used on horizontal video badges that contain either the video's total duration or a live status identifier. Font size: 16 - 16 - 18 - 18

breadcrumb.description: This text style is used for the last items in a breadcrumbs chain. It is commonly used in article pages and is a h1 in html. breadcrumbLink.description: This text style is used for breadcrumb links that are commonly used in article pages. This text style's font size parameter is controlled by the breadcrumbFontSize variable. 15 - 15 - 15 - 12. Breadcrumb labels are smaller on largest devices.

breadcrumbLinkHover.description: This text style is used for the hover state of breadcrumbs that are commonly used in article pages. This text style's font size parameter is controlled by the breadcrumbFontSize variable. 15 - 15 - 15 - 12. Breadcrumb labels are smaller on largest devices.

breakingNewsText.description: Use this text style on breaking news headlines that horizontally scroll in the breaking news animated strip. Font size constant 21.

breakingNewsUpperTitle.description: Use this text style on the upper title of the breaking news headline strip. Font size constant 13.

breakingNewsLowerTitle.description: Use this font style on the breaking news badge's lower title. Font size constant 23.

buttonLabel.description: This text style is used on button labels. Its font size variable is currently in the Density collection. Font size changes across devices: 15 - 17 - 19 Current online CSS .btn--narrow & .btn

partnerLinkButtonLabel.description: This text style is used on buttons that are commonly used inside of a container for advertizers and partners. This text is used in buttons that open links to external content.  Font size: 16 - 16 - 16 - 18

chipsLabel.description: This text style is used on the chips component. They are commonly used for filtering parameters. font size: 16 - 16 - 16 - 18

footerCardLink.description: This text style is used for link texts contained inside cards that commonly show up at the bottom of pages in footers. This link text style's font size parameter uses the label2 font size variable.

footerLinkSeparator.description: This text style is found on footers that separate links with a vertical bar. Font size remains constant at 20 px across devices.

footerLinks.description: This text style is used in footer links that show up at the bottom of content pages. Font size constant at 11px.

footerLinkUser&OfferPages.description: User data and offer pages use this text style on footer links. Font size remains constant at 18px.

textInputFieldLabel.description: This text style is used in dropdowns and other text input fields such as date inputs, search input fields and other inputs for text found in forms for example. Font size references a variable from the density collection. 15 - 17 - 19

liveTickerHeadline.description: This text style is used on live ticker headlines. The font size changes between device sizes. 22 - 22 - 32 -32

liveTickerTimeStamp.description: Use this text style on the live ticker time stamps. 14 - 14 - 16 - 16

podcastPlayerLabel.description: This text style is used on controller labels of the podcast media player. Font size: 16 - 16 - 16 - 18

videoPlayerTime.description: Use this text style on video player time badges that display elapsed, total or live information text labels. This text style references the label2 font size variable. 15px constant

newsTickerTimeStamp.description: The vertical newsticker component has timestamps that use this text style. 16 - 16 - 16 - 18

newsTickerKicker.description: This text style is a component level option for the newsticker kicker. Currently the newsticker kicker uses the semantic text style kicker3. This text style references the semantic one.

newsTickerHeadline.description: This text style is used on NewsTicker Headlines. It references the semantic level text style headline3. 28 - 28 - 36 - 40

textColorAccentConstant.description:
Applies to text elements requiring fixed brand color usage (e.g., permanent links, brand slogans on constant backgrounds).
Behavior: Constant  maintains identical red tone across Light and Dark mode.

textColorPrimary.description:
Main text color used for body copy and all primary textual content. Ensures optimal readability and contrast on standard surfaces.
Behavior: Dynamic  switches between dark text on light backgrounds and light text on dark backgrounds.

textColorMuted.description:
Muted text tone for subtle information, timestamps, or inactive text elements.
Behavior: Dynamic  adjusts between mid-gray in Light mode and lighter gray in Dark mode.

textColorPrimaryInverse.description:
Inverse text color used on opposing surfaces (e.g., white text on red or dark backgrounds).
Behavior: Dynamic  alternates between light and dark mode.

textColorPrimaryConstant.description:
Used when primary text color must remain fixed regardless of mode (e.g., on light constant backgrounds).
Behavior: Constant  same tone across Light and Dark mode.

textColorSuccessConstant.description:
Used for positive or success-related messages (e.g., Saved, Success, or confirmation text) on success surface colors.
Behavior: Constant  green tone remains consistent across both modes.

textColorPrimaryInverseConstant.description:
Fixed inverse tone for text that always appears on dark surfaces (e.g., hero headlines or persistent dark cards).
Behavior: Constant  unchanged across modes.

textColorSecondary.description:
Secondary text color used for supportive information, subtitles, and less prominent text.
Behavior: Dynamic  adapts between neutral tones to maintain proper contrast per theme. In 2025 css it is called figure meta.

textColorAttentionHigh.description:
Used for strong warnings, errors, or destructive action labels.
Behavior: Constant  red color remains unchanged between Light and Dark mode for visibility and recognition.

textColorAccent.description: Accent text color used for links, interactive text, or highlighted key words. Changes from a red in light mode to a white in dark mode.

textColorAttentionMedium.description:
Represents medium attention states, often used in warnings or pending states.
Behavior: Constant  same orange tone across Light and Dark mode.

textColorOnDarkSurface.description:
Used for text displayed on dark surfaces to ensure maximum legibility and contrast.
Behavior: Constant  always light neutral to guarantee accessibility on dark backgrounds.

surfaceColorPrimary.description:
Primary surface color used for main backgrounds and large layout areas (e.g., page background, primary containers).
Behavior: Dynamic  adapts between light and dark surface tokens to maintain legibility and hierarchy.

surfaceColorSecondary.description:
Used for secondary surface layers such as cards, panels, or nested containers that need to differentiate themselves from the primary surface. .
Behavior: Dynamic  adapts brightness level based on mode for appropriate depth contrast.

surfaceColorPrimaryInverse.description:
Inverse of the primary surface, used when Light and Dark surfaces are swapped (e.g., inverse cards or elevated sections).
Behavior: Dynamic  switches between dark and light values depending on mode.

surfaceColorPrimaryConstantLight.description:
A fixed light surface tone used when a consistent light background is required (e.g., light panels within dark layouts).
Behavior: Constant  remains the same in both modes.

surfaceColorPrimaryConstantDark.description:
A fixed dark surface tone used for dark overlays or nested dark sections inside light layouts.
Behavior: Constant  identical across Light and Dark mode.

surfaceColorQuartenary.description: HIghtest elevation surface color, typically used for grouping or background accents to differentiate themselves from all previous surface color options. Uses corresponding light/dark tones for consistent layering.

surfaceColorSuccess.description:
Success-related background used for positive notifications, confirmation surfaces, or success banners.
Behavior: Constant  remains the same across Light and Dark mode to ensure brand alignment.

surfaceColorTertiary.description:
Tertiary background layer for inner containers, grouped content, or subtle elevation steps  that need to differentiate themselves from the primary and secondary surfaces.
Behavior: Dynamic  switches between light and dark tertiary tones.

surfaceColorTertiaryGradientStop.description:
Represents tertiary-level gradient background.
Currently used on skeletons.

surfaceColorTertiaryInverse.description:
Inverse tertiary background, applied when Light and Dark surfaces are reversed (e.g., dark-on-light cards).
Behavior: Dynamic  swaps values between modes for contrast preservation.

surfaceColorPrimaryGradientStop.description: Defines the end stops for primary surface gradients, creating visual depth or elevation. Used next to sliders buttons and slider container edges for fading out content. Behavior: Dynamic  light gradients in Light mode, dark gradients in Dark mode.

surfaceColorSecondaryGradientStop.description:
Used for secondary surface gradients or subtle depth layers across backgrounds.
Behavior: Dynamic  adapts to mode brightness for smooth gradient transitions.

surfaceColorQuartenaryInverse.description:
Inverse of the quartenary surface, used for background reversals in mixed-layout areas.
Behavior: Dynamic  inverts between dark and light tones depending on mode.

kickerTextColorOnSurface.description:
Used for kicker text and category labels placed directly on standard surface backgrounds.
Behavior: Dynamic  adjusts between red for Light and a neutral tone in Dark modes.

headlineColorPrimary.description:
Primary color for headings and display typography. Ensures clear hierarchy and optimal readability on main surfaces. Adapds its color based on the brand mode for brand recognition.
Behavior: Dynamic  dark text in Light mode, light text in Dark mode.

headlineColorWhiteConst.description:
Fixed white heading color used on dark or colored backgrounds (e.g., hero sections, banners) that remain constant across modes.
Behavior: Constant  remains white in both Light and Dark mode.

kickerTextColorOnRed.description:
Specialized kicker color for use on red or brand-colored backgrounds (e.g., red kicker bg within teaser cards).
Behavior: Constant  remains consistent across light and darkmode.

kickerTextColorOnDarkBg.description:
Applied to kicker or meta text on dark colored backgrounds to maintain high legibility.
Behavior: Constant  always uses semi-transparent white for consistent readability.

kickerTextColorOnBrightBg.description:
Used for kicker text placed on bright or light colored backgrounds. Ensures balanced contrast without harsh visual dominance.
Behavior: Constant  remains semi-transparent black across both modes.

colorSecondaryActive.description:
Defines the active state color for secondary actions (e.g., secondary buttons, tabs, or toggles).
Behavior: Dynamic  light gray in Light mode and bright gray in Dark mode to maintain perceptual balance.

colorPrimaryActive.description:
Used to represent the active or pressed state of primary actions such as tabs or links.
Behavior: Constant  identical value across modes for consistent interaction feedback.

colorSecondaryDisabled.description:
Used for disabled secondary elements, ensuring reduced visual prominence while maintaining legibility.
Behavior: Dynamic  adapts neutral tones based on theme brightness.

colorPrimaryDisabled.description:
Defines the disabled color for primary components (e.g., disabled primary buttons, inputs). Reduces emphasis and contrast to signal inactivity.
Behavior: Dynamic  slightly lighter in Light mode and darker in Dark mode to remain visually accessible.

colorSecondaryActiveInverse.description:
Inverse variant of the secondary active state, applied on dark backgrounds or inverse layouts.
Behavior: Dynamic  switches between bright and dark tones depending on the background.

colorTertiaryActive.description:
Represents active or pressed states for tertiary elements (e.g., link highlights, icons, or subtle interactive surfaces).
Behavior: Constant  uses the same green success tone across Light and Dark mode.

colorTertiaryDisabled.description:
Represents disabled states for tertiary levels, maintaining subtle visibility without drawing attention.
Behavior: Dynamic  adjusts between gray tones for Light and Dark mode consistency.

borderColorMediumContrast.description:
Medium-emphasis border color for standard outlines, input fields, or separators that require visible yet non-dominant contrast.
Behavior: Dynamic  adjusts to maintain legibility in Light and Dark themes.

borderColorLowContrast.description:
Used for subtle dividers and low-emphasis borders in neutral areas (e.g., card outlines, input containers).
Dynamic  light gray in Light mode, dark gray in Dark mode.

borderColorHighContrast.description:
High-emphasis border color for clear delineation between surfaces (e.g., focus rings, high-contrast UI zones).
Behavior: Dynamic  light surfaces use a darker neutral, dark surfaces a light neutral tone.

borderColorLowContrastConstant.description: Applies to UI elements that must visually remain the same regardless of theme (e.g., brand containers, static illustrations). Identical tone across Light and Dark mode.

borderColorSuccess.description:
Used for success states and validation borders (e.g., input success outlines or confirmation frames).
Behavior: Constant  same success tone across modes for consistent feedback semantics.

borderColorWarning.description:
Defines border color for warning and error-related components, typically used for input validation or caution zones.
Behavior: Constant  retains the same red warning tone in both Light and Dark modes.

borderColorPrimaryDisabled.description: Applied to disabled states of primary elements (e.g., buttons, inputs) to visually reduce emphasis and indicate inactivity.

borderColorSecondaryDisabled.description: Used for secondary component borders in a disabled state (e.g., secondary buttons, inactive input outlines).

coreColorPrimary.description: Used as the main brand color for key interactive elements such as primary buttons, active states, and prominent highlights. It remains constant across Light and Dark Mode.

coreColorSecondary.description: Defines the secondary brand tone. This variable changes across Light and Dark Mode.

coreColorTertiary.description: Represents tertiary brand accents. This variable changes across Light and Dark Mode.

coreColorSecondaryConstant.description: Use this on elements that must maintain the white color even in dark mode.

coreColorTertiaryConstant.description: Use this on elements that need to maintain the dark color across themes and color modes.

iconColorPrimary.description: Primary icon color on primary surfaces.

iconColorInverse.description:
Inverse icon color for use on contrasting backgrounds (e.g., light icons on dark surfaces or dark icons on bright surfaces).
Behavior: Dynamic  switches between light and dark.

iconColorSecondaryConstant.description: Secondary icon tone for less prominent actions or supportive iconography (e.g., secondary buttons, tool icons). Remains unchanged across modes.

iconColorConstantOnDark.description:
Used for icons displayed on dark backgrounds that dont change colors, ensuring sufficient contrast and legibility.
Behavior: Constant  always uses a neutral bright value.

iconColorPrimaryConstant.description:
Used for icons that must remain visually consistent regardless of mode (e.g.,  icons that are on surfaces that don't change color).
Identical tone in both Light and Dark mode.

iconColorSuccess.description:
Represents success or confirmation icons (e.g., checkmarks, completion indicators).
Behavior: Constant  same success green tone across Light and Dark mode.

labelColorPrimary.description:
Primary label color used for labels, badges, or tag text on light backgrounds. Ensures strong readability and visual hierarchy.
Behavior: Dynamic  dark neutral in Light mode, light neutral in Dark mode.

labelColorSecondary.description:
Secondary label tone used for less prominent text such as secondary badges or supporting labels.
Behavior: Dynamic  adapts between mid-grays for Light and Dark surfaces.

labelColorDisabled.description:
Disabled label tone indicating inactive or unavailable states in UI elements.
Behavior: Dynamic  lighter gray in Light mode, darker neutral in Dark mode.

labelColorPrimaryConstant.description:
Used when primary label color should remain unchanged across modes in static UI areas.
Behavior: Constant  identical tone in both Light and Dark mode.

labelColorPrimaryInverseConstant.description:
Fixed inverse label tone applied where white or bright text must always appear, regardless of theme.
Behavior: Constant  remains bright neutral in both Light and Dark mode.

labelColorTertiary.description:
Tertiary label tone for subtle, low-emphasis UI text such as placeholder text or tertiary badges.
Behavior: Constant  identical tone across both modes for stable hierarchy.

labelColorPrimaryInverse.description:
Inverse version of the primary label color, used on dark or colored backgrounds.
Behavior: Dynamic  switches between light and dark.

attentionColorHigh.description: High-level attention color used for errors, destructive actions, and critical alerts (e.g., delete actions, error states). Remains red in both Light and Dark mode for immediate recognition.

accentColorPrimary.description: Primary accent color used to emphasize interactive or highlight elements such as links, selection states, or focus indicators. Adapts in Darkmode to a fully white tone.

attentionColorMedium.description: Medium-level attention tone representing stronger caution or intermediate alert states. Commonly applied in warning messages. Constant  identical in both modes.

attentionColorLow.description: Low-level warning or attention tone, typically used for informational or cautionary messages. Same yellow tone across Light and Dark to maintain recognition.

accentColorPrimaryConstant.description: Used for accent highlights that must remain visually consistent across themes (e.g., brand identifiers, logos, or fixed emphasis areas). Color value does not change between Light and Dark mode.

attentionColorSuccessPrimary.description: Primary success color used to indicate positive states, confirmations, or completed actions (e.g., success banners, icons, or badges). Remains the same across modes to ensure recognizability and consistency.

attentionColorExtraLow.description: Very low-contrast background tone used for information or system-neutral surfaces, often for tooltips or quiet information highlights. Dynamic  light neutral in Light mode and dark neutral in Dark mode.

attentionColorSuccessSecondary.description: Secondary success tone used for secondary states. Maintains the same color in both Light and Dark mode for clarity.

overlayScrimBlack.description: A semi-transparent black overlay used to dim background content when modals, drawers, or dialogs are active. Identical opacity and tone in both Light and Dark mode to ensure consistent overlay depth.

overlayScrimWhite.description:
A semi-transparent white overlay used to brighten or fade background layers, often applied behind bottom sheets or temporary panels.
Behavior: Constant  same opacity level across modes to preserve uniform layering behavior.

breadcrumbTextColorIdle.description: Use this token on breadcrumbs that are in their default idle state. This token changes color between light and dark modes. L:035 / D:096

breadcrumbTextColorHover.description: Use this token on breadcrumbs that the user's pointer is hovering on or clicked on. This token changes color between light and dark modes. L:015 / D:100

menuScrolledSurfaceGradientColor.description: Used on a thin part at the top of header in navigation menu.

alertSurfaceColorConstant.description: On marketing offer surfaces this variable is  used.

selectionBorderColor.description: Checkboxes and Radio buttons use this variable for their border.

heySeparatorColor.description: This is the most used color for separators across Bild products.

scrollBarTrackBgColor.description: Used as the background surface color scroll bars. Found on components that vertically or horizontally stack elements.

scrollBarThumbBgColor.description: Use on the scroll bar interactive element which shows where the scroll view is positioned inside the full extent of the scrolling space.

galleryPaginationElementActiveOpacity.description: Use this on gallery slider pagination elements. This can also be applied to hover states of those elements.

sliderTrackBgColor.description: This variable is used on audio player slider bars. It references a pure white with 35% opacity.

sliderButtonOpacity.description: When users hover on gallery slider buttons the opacity changes to 90%.

vidPlayerControlButtonsBgHoverColor.description: This variable is used for hover states of video player control buttons.

textColorAccentConstant.description:
Applies to text elements requiring fixed brand color usage (e.g., permanent links, brand slogans on constant backgrounds).
Behavior: Constant  maintains identical red tone across Light and Dark mode.

textColorPrimary.description:
Main text color used for body copy and all primary textual content. Ensures optimal readability and contrast on standard surfaces.
Behavior: Dynamic  switches between dark text on light backgrounds and light text on dark backgrounds.

textColorMuted.description:
Muted text tone for subtle information, timestamps, or inactive text elements.
Behavior: Dynamic  adjusts between mid-gray in Light mode and lighter gray in Dark mode.

textColorPrimaryInverse.description:
Inverse text color used on opposing surfaces (e.g., white text on red or dark backgrounds).
Behavior: Dynamic  alternates between light and dark mode.

textColorPrimaryConstant.description:
Used when primary text color must remain fixed regardless of mode (e.g., on light constant backgrounds).
Behavior: Constant  same tone across Light and Dark mode.

textColorSuccessConstant.description:
Used for positive or success-related messages (e.g., Saved, Success, or confirmation text) on success surface colors.
Behavior: Constant  green tone remains consistent across both modes.

textColorPrimaryInverseConstant.description:
Fixed inverse tone for text that always appears on dark surfaces (e.g., hero headlines or persistent dark cards).
Behavior: Constant  unchanged across modes.

textColorSecondary.description:
Secondary text color used for supportive information, subtitles, and less prominent text.
Behavior: Dynamic  adapts between neutral tones to maintain proper contrast per theme. In 2025 css it is called figure meta.

textColorAttentionHigh.description:
Used for strong warnings, errors, or destructive action labels.
Behavior: Constant  red color remains unchanged between Light and Dark mode for visibility and recognition.

textColorAccent.description: Accent text color used for links, interactive text, or highlighted key words. Changes from a red in light mode to a white in dark mode.

textColorAttentionMedium.description:
Represents medium attention states, often used in warnings or pending states.
Behavior: Constant  same orange tone across Light and Dark mode.

textColorOnDarkSurface.description:
Used for text displayed on dark surfaces to ensure maximum legibility and contrast.
Behavior: Constant  always light neutral to guarantee accessibility on dark backgrounds.

surfaceColorPrimary.description:
Primary surface color used for main backgrounds and large layout areas (e.g., page background, primary containers).
Behavior: Dynamic  adapts between light and dark surface tokens to maintain legibility and hierarchy.

surfaceColorSecondary.description:
Used for secondary surface layers such as cards, panels, or nested containers that need to differentiate themselves from the primary surface. .
Behavior: Dynamic  adapts brightness level based on mode for appropriate depth contrast.

surfaceColorPrimaryInverse.description:
Inverse of the primary surface, used when Light and Dark surfaces are swapped (e.g., inverse cards or elevated sections).
Behavior: Dynamic  switches between dark and light values depending on mode.

surfaceColorPrimaryConstantLight.description:
A fixed light surface tone used when a consistent light background is required (e.g., light panels within dark layouts).
Behavior: Constant  remains the same in both modes.

surfaceColorPrimaryConstantDark.description:
A fixed dark surface tone used for dark overlays or nested dark sections inside light layouts.
Behavior: Constant  identical across Light and Dark mode.

surfaceColorQuartenary.description: HIghtest elevation surface color, typically used for grouping or background accents to differentiate themselves from all previous surface color options. Uses corresponding light/dark tones for consistent layering.

surfaceColorSuccess.description:
Success-related background used for positive notifications, confirmation surfaces, or success banners.
Behavior: Constant  remains the same across Light and Dark mode to ensure brand alignment.

surfaceColorTertiary.description:
Tertiary background layer for inner containers, grouped content, or subtle elevation steps  that need to differentiate themselves from the primary and secondary surfaces.
Behavior: Dynamic  switches between light and dark tertiary tones.

surfaceColorTertiaryGradientStop.description:
Represents tertiary-level gradient background.
Currently used on skeletons.

surfaceColorTertiaryInverse.description:
Inverse tertiary background, applied when Light and Dark surfaces are reversed (e.g., dark-on-light cards).
Behavior: Dynamic  swaps values between modes for contrast preservation.

surfaceColorPrimaryGradientStop.description: Defines the end stops for primary surface gradients, creating visual depth or elevation. Used next to sliders buttons and slider container edges for fading out content. Behavior: Dynamic  light gradients in Light mode, dark gradients in Dark mode.

surfaceColorSecondaryGradientStop.description:
Used for secondary surface gradients or subtle depth layers across backgrounds.
Behavior: Dynamic  adapts to mode brightness for smooth gradient transitions.

surfaceColorQuartenaryInverse.description:
Inverse of the quartenary surface, used for background reversals in mixed-layout areas.
Behavior: Dynamic  inverts between dark and light tones depending on mode.

kickerTextColorOnSurface.description:
Used for kicker text and category labels placed directly on standard surface backgrounds.
Behavior: Dynamic  adjusts between red for Light and a neutral tone in Dark modes.

headlineColorPrimary.description:
Primary color for headings and display typography. Ensures clear hierarchy and optimal readability on main surfaces. Adapds its color based on the brand mode for brand recognition.
Behavior: Dynamic  dark text in Light mode, light text in Dark mode.

menuShadowVisibility.description: This color type variables are only in this semantic collection for making subtle shadow effects change visibility across device sizes. Shadow alpha: 10 - 10 - 10 - 0

heyInputShadowVisibility.description: This color type variables are only in this semantic collection for making subtle shadow effects change visibility across device sizes. Shadow alpha: 0 - 0 - 0 - 10

menuItemFontSize.description: This variable is used on the menu link lane and on the mobile side menu drawer.

newsTickerTimeLineHeight.description: Figma currently does not allow for percentages in Line Height variables. The values in this token are the result of multiplying the font size by the line height variable defined on the Bild home css -> newsTickerTime line height: 1.3. Line height for this component does not change across devices.

breadcrumbFontSize.description: 15 - 15 - 15 - 12 -- Breadcrumbs have a slightly larger font size on mobile devices compared to when they are rendered on larger desktop devices.

breadcrumbLineHeight.description: 15 - 15 - 15 - 12 -- Breadcrumbs have a slightly larger font size on mobile devices compared to when they are rendered on larger desktop devices.

liveTickerHeadlinesFontSize.description: This variable is used for the font size of live ticker headlines. 22 - 22 - 32 - 32

liveTickerTimeStampFontSize.description: This variable is used for the live ticker time stamp font size. 14 - 14 - 16 - 16

avatarFontFamily.description: This variable is used in avatar text styles. It receives values from the Brand Tokens Collection. Bild: GothamXNarrow; SpoBi: Inter; Ads: LucidaGrande

appAvatarFontFamily.description: This variable is used for setting the font of avatars on iOS and Android platforms. This is subject to review.

avatarLabelFontSize.description: This variable is used on avatar names in article pages. Bild: 16 - 16 - 16 - 18; SpoBi&Ads: 13 - 13 - 13 - 15

avatarArticleSize.description: This variable is used for setting the size of avatar images in article pages. It references the sizeConstMD variable from the "generic" semantic collection. Its value is 48 across devices.

avatarAuthorPageSize.description: 96 - 96 - 130 - 130 This variable is used for controlling the size of the avatar image on author pages.

avatarLabelLineHeight.description: This variable is used for controlling the line height of avatar texts. Its values influence the stacking space between avatar texts. 21 - 21 - 21 - 23

avatarLaneGapSpace.description: This variable is used for setting the inline space between multiple avatars that are horizontally placed in a lane when an article has multiple authors. 16 - 16 - 24 - 24

articleMetaFontFamily.description: This variable is used on the font size of article day&time stamp that usually shows up along with the article author avatars. On app versions this variable is used for the avatar names. This variable references variables from the branding collection.

articleTopMarginSpace.description: 8 | 8 | 12 | 16 - This space variable is used at the top edge of the article main content bounding box.

articleKickerFontSize.description: This variable is used to control the font size of kickers in the heading section of article pages. 18 - 18 - 22 - 30

articleHeadlineFontSize.description: 40 - 40 - 72 - 100 - This variable uses the semantic variables headline2 for XS&SM, headline1 for MD&LG

articleGalleryATeaserWidth.description: same as standard teaser width size variable

articleImageCaptionLineHeight.description: this component level variable references the branding variables

articleContentStackSpace.description: 16 - 16 - 24 - 32 - This variable creates the vertical spacing between different article body elements such as avatars, media players, corssheadings, paragraphs, field sets, images, tables, quotes, videos, social embeds, etc.

articleHeadingsStackSpace.description: 12 | 12 | 12 | 16 - This spacing variable is used for the space between article page heading kickers, headlines and subheadlines. XS&SM need review; correct value might be 8

articleMetaFontSize.description: This variable is used on the font size of article day&time stamp that usually shows up along with the article author avatars. On app versions this variable is used for the avatar names. 12 - 12 - 14 - 16

articleContentInlineSpace.description: 16 | 16 | 72 | 162 - This variable is used for making the left and right spacings around article content blocks. Current css has the article-body class assigned to a div and article body contains these horizontal padding values.

articleHeadingsInlineSpace.description: 16 | 16 | 72 | 16 - This variable is used for the left and right space within the article page headings container which holds the article page kicker, headline and subheadline.

specsFontFamily.description: This variable is used only for texts and labels that form part of this design system's documentation.

bildDesignFrameSpace.description: Variable used in spacing parameters of bild.design webpage mockups. move to bild.design group maybe

dsMainContainerSpace.description: This variable is used on documentation pages. This is an alternative variable to the main container max width variable. 0 - 0 - 68 - 68

mainContentStageSize.description: This variable is used as a max width size for content blocks. For mobile devices this var references the DSysDocsWidthSize var 320 - 750 - 962 - 1024

foundationsBannerHeightSize.description: This variable is used on documentation pages that have an artistic banner at the top of the page that is related to the foundation topic on the page. 80 - 80 -80 - 140

dsCaptionStackSpace0_5x.description: This variable is used in documentation pages that have small caption or lables along with a UI component documented. 4 - 4 - 6 - 8

1columnMobile.description: This variable is used only for this design system's component tests.

thinBannerVerticalHeightSize.description: This variable is currently used on a thin gallery that appears on desktop websites with petbook and other "books" content. Its height changes to a large height on mobile sites. 558 - 558 - 558 - 186

docHeaderHeightSize.description: This variable is used on documentation headers that contain info about platfroms and component names. 144 - 144 - 160 - 180

footerFontSize.description: This variable is used on footer links that commonly show up at the bottom of pages. The font size parameter remains constant at 11 px across device sizes.

inputFieldFontSize.description: This variable controls texts inside of input fields such as dropdowns, date input and other text inputs that appear in forms for example. compact 15 - default 17 - spacious 19

accordionLabelFontFamily.description: This variable exists specifically for changing the accordion font family across brands. It is subject to review. Bild: GothamXNarrow, SpoBi: Inter, Ads: LucindaGrande

aTeaserKickerFontSize.description: 16 - 16 - 22 - 24 This variable references the semantic variables kicker3fontsize and kicker2fontsize. At the 600px breakpoint smaller devices use the kicker3 variable

aTeaserHeadlineFontSize.description: This variable references the semantic variables headline3 (XS&SM) and headline2 (MD&LG). 28 - 28 - 48 - 64

stdTeaserBadgesMarginSpace.description: This variable is used for creating space around the outside of a subscription badge or video icon badge.

stdTeaserKickerHeadlineStackSpace.description: 2 | 2 | 2 | 2 - This variable is used on the standard teaser vertical spacing between the kicker and the headline. It references the semantic variable stackSpaceConst3XS

quadHeadlineFontSize.description: This component level variable is used on the quad teaser headline. It references the semantic level variable headline1. 48 - 48 - 72 - 100

teaserBadgesMarginSpace.description: This variable is used for creating space around the outside of a subscription badge or video icon badge.

teaserBadgesHeightSizeLG.description: This token is for controling the height of badges that are inside of teasers. 32 - 32 - 32 - 40

partnerLinkButtonLabelFontSize.description: Use this variable for controlling the font size of partner buttons. 16 - 16 - 16 - 18

buttonContentMinHeightSize.description: This fixed height variable ensures that the button maintains a consistent height, even when the icon is not active.

videoTimeBadgeCornerSize.description: This variable is used on video player badges that display a red play icon on top of a white square next to a time stamp. This variable references the borderRadiusXS. Constant value of 2 across device sizes.

videoTimeBadgeFontSize.description: 16 - 16 - 18 - 18 -- This variable is used to control the videoTimeBadge text style's font size parameter. The typography style that uses this variable is the videoTimeBadge style. The badge that uses this variable appears on the upper right corner of horizontal videos.

videoTimeBadgeSize.description: 24 - 24 - 32 - 40 - This variable is used on horizontal video badges that contain a red play icon on top of a white square next to a timestamp.

videoRedPlayIconHeightSize.description: This variable is used for changing the red play icon inside the white square.

videoAdBadgeFontSize.description: 14 - 14 - 16 - 16 -- This variable is used in the videoAdBadge font size parameter.

galleryPaginationContainerWebInlineSpace.description: 8 - 8 - 12 - 12 - this component level variable references the inlineSpaceConst semantic variables; SM for smaller devices, MD for larger devices

galleryPaginationContainerStackSpace.description: 12 - 12 - 16 - 16 - this component level variable references the semantic

BadgesInnerStackSpace.description: This space variable is used for creating the top and bottom space between a badge's text label and the surface that the text label is on top of.

BadgesInnerInlineSpace.description: This space variable is used for creating the left and right space between a badge's text label and the badge background surface that the text label is on top of.

adLabelBadgeHeightSize.description: 30 - 30 - 30 - 30 - This variable is used on the Advert rectangular badge that is found above an ad containers.

sectionTitle&ArrowInlineSpace.description: This variable is used on large title headings that are h2 elements in html and indicate a new section in the user interface. This space changes when a user hovers over the large title.

sectionTitle&ArrowInlineSpaceActive.description: This variable is used for increasing the space between the text and the arrow at the end of the large title text. On mobile devices there is no hover state so this variables values are the same as the default state values.

audioPlayerFontSize.description: This variable is used in the text style dedicated to audio player labels for elapsed time, reproduction speed and short functionality description text. 16 - 16 - 16 - 18

chipsFontSize.description: This variable is used on the chips font size parameter of the chips text style. The font size changes only for the change between larger device widths and any device smaller than the largest. 16 - 16 -16 - 18

tabLabelFontSize.description: Tab labels font size remain constant at 16px across devices and breakpoints. This behavior can be seen on the Mein Konto page tabs for purchases and payment data.

tabLabelFontSizeLine.description: Tab labels font size remain constant at 16px across devices and breakpoints. This behavior can be seen on the Mein Konto page tabs for purchases and payment data.

appsTabsLabelFontSize.description: Tab labels font size remain constant at 16px across devices and breakpoints. This behavior can be seen on the Mein Konto page tabs for purchases and payment data.

appsTabsLabelLineHeight.description: Tab labels font size remain constant at 16px across devices and breakpoints. This behavior can be seen on the Mein Konto page tabs for purchases and payment data.

galleryTeaserTitleBottomSpace.description: This token is used to create more bottom padding space on system teaser headlines inside the gallery to avoid overlapping with the pagination.

galleryTeaserAppGapSpace.description: This token is used to create more bottom padding space on system teaser headlines inside the gallery to avoid overlapping with the pagination.

paywallCardPriceTagFontSize.description: This variable is used on the paywall card price tag. 64 constant

paywallCardPriceNoteFontSize.description: This variable is used on the paywall card text under the price tag. 40 - 40 - 40 - 40

appToggleItemLabelFontSize.description: This variable is used on labels in list items with toggle switches found in app preferences. 14 - 14 - 16 - 18

appToggleItemLabelLineHeight.description: This variable is used on labels in list items with toggle switches found in app preferences. 14.1 - 14.1 - 16.2 - 18.2

visilbleMobileOnly.description: Use for showing elements on mobile viewport sizes only

visilbleDesktopOnly.description: Use for showing elements on desktop viewport sizes only

visilbleAbove600px.description: Use for showing elements on viewport sizes above 600 px

visilbleBelow600px.description: Use for showing elements on viewport sizes below 600 px

hideOnMobile.description: Use for hiding elements on mobile viewport sizes

visilbleTabletOnly.description: Use for showing elements on tablet viewport sizes only

hideOnDesktop.description: Use for hiding elements on desktop viewport sizes only

changeOnMD.description: This variable is used for controlling size changes across device sizes on some components such as the vertical newsticker cards and the search results cards. Both have cards that change layouts at different breakpoints.

bodyFontFamily.description: This variable references the bodyFontFamily variable from the branding collection.

headline1FontWeightST.description: This variable is a string type variable for controlling not only headline font weight but also the italic style for Sport Bild headlines.

Display1FontSize.description: This variable is used on the font size parameter for the display1 text style. 40 - 40 - 72 - 120

Display2FontSize.description: This variable is used for the font size parameter of the Display2 text style. 36 - 36 - 42 - 64

Display3FontSize.description: This variable is used on the display3 font size parameter of the display3 text style. 28 - 28 - 32 - 40

Headline1FontSize.description: This token is used for the headline1 text style's font size parameter. 48 - 48 - 72 - 100

Headline2FontSize.description: This token is used on the headline2 text style's font size parameter. 40 - 40 - 48 - 64

Headline3FontSize.description: This token is used on the headline3 text style's font size parameter. 28 - 28 - 36 - 40

Headline4FontSize.description: This token controls the headline4 text style's font size parameter: 22 - 22 - 26 - 32

bodyFontSize.description: This variable is used on the body text style's font size parameter. It remains constant at 21.

label3FontSize.description: This token is used in the label3 text style's font size parameter. Its value remains constant at 12 across device sizes.

label2FontSize.description: This variable controls the label2 text style's font size parameter. Its value remains constant at 15.

label1FontSize.description: This token is used in the label1 text style font size parameter. Its value remains constant at 17 across device sizes.

label1FontSizeResponsive.description: 10 - 10 - 15 - 17 Use this label font size when you want your label's font size to change across device sizes.

label4FontSize.description: This token is used in the font size parameter of the label4 text style. The value remains constant at 8.

callout1FontSize.description: This token is used for the font size parameter of the callout text style. 18 - 18 - 22 - 22

footnote1FontSize.description: This token is used on the footnote text style font size parameter. 16 - 16 - 16 - 18

footnote2FontSize.description: This token is used in the font size parameter of the footnote2 text style. 12 - 12 - 12 - 16

Kicker1FontSize.description: Values come from NMT Figma File 01_Foundation; in online CSS this is kicker0. 18 - 18 - 22 - 30 - This variable does not exist yet in online css. Online css is called kicker0 for smallest font size.

Kicker2FontSize.description: Values come from comparing NMT Figma File 01_Foundation to online CSS. Online kickers are numbered from 0 to 3. This DS uses 1 to 4 following html convention of h1, h2, h3, etc. 18 - 18 - 22 - 24

Kicker3FontSize.description: Values come from comparing NMT Figma File 01_Foundation to online CSS. Online kickers are numbered from 0 to 3. 16 - 16 - 18 - 20

Kicker4FontSize.description: Values come from comparing NMT Figma File 01_Foundation to online CSS. Online kickers are numbered from 0 to 3. 14 - 14 - 16 - 16

subheadline1FontSize.description: This token controls the subheadline1 font size parameter. 24 - 24 - 32 - 36

quoteFontSize.description: 16 - 16 - 18 - 20 -- This variable is used for controlling the font size of the quote text style.

bodyLineHeight.description: Figma's font line height currently does not allow for multipliers as is used on current website css var(--body-line-height)

label1LineHeight.description: This variable is used in the label1 text style's line height parameter. It references branding variables for brand specific line heights.

quoteLineHeight.description: This variable is used in the quote text style line height parameter.

letterSpacingPositiveSM.description: 0.5 | 0.5 | 0.5 | 0.5 | This variable takes primitive letter spacing variables and creates this semantic variable for use on designs that change across device sizes.

letterSpacingPositiveLG.description: 2 | 2 | 2 | 3 | This variable takes primitive letter spacing variables and creates this semantic variable for use on designs that change across device sizes.

letterSpacingPositiveMD.description: 1 | 1 | 1 | 1 | This variable takes primitive letter spacing variables and creates this semantic variable for use on designs that change across device sizes.

letterSpacingNone.description: 0 | 0 | 0 | 0 | This variable takes primitive letter spacing variables and creates this semantic variable for use on designs that change across device sizes.

letterSpacingNegativeMD.description: -1 | -1 | -1 | -1 | This variable takes primitive letter spacing variables and creates this semantic variable for use on designs that change across device sizes.

letterSpacingNegativeLG.description: -2 | -2 | -2 | -3 | This variable takes primitive letter spacing variables and creates this semantic variable for use on designs that change across device sizes.

letterSpacingNegativeXS.description: -0.25 | -0.25 | -0.25 | -0.25 | This variable takes primitive letter spacing variables and creates this semantic variable for use on designs that change across device sizes. This letter spacing was only found in large titles on iOS mobile app large title component.

letterSpacingPositiveXS.description: 0.25 | 0.25 | 0.25 | 0.25 | This variable takes primitive letter spacing variables and creates this semantic variable for use on designs that change across device sizes.

display1LetterSpacing.description: -0.5 | -0.5 | -1 | -2 | This variable is used for the letter spacing parameter of the display1 text style. On smaller devices the value is smaller than on larger devices. On desktop devices the letter spacing is further reduced for making the text style more compact.

display2LetterSpacing.description: -0.5 | -0.5 | -1 | -1 | This variable is used for the letter spacing parameter of the display2 text style. On smaller devices the value is smaller than on larger devices.

display3LetterSpacing.description: -0.5 | -0.5 | -1 | -1 | This variable is used for the letter spacing parameter of the display3 text style. On smaller devices the value is smaller than on larger devices.

heyInputShadowVisibility.description: This color type variables are only in this semantic collection for making subtle shadow effects change visibility across device sizes. Shadow alpha: 0 - 0 - 0 - 10

menuItemFontSize.description: This variable is used on the menu link lane and on the mobile side menu drawer.

newsTickerTimeLineHeight.description: Figma currently does not allow for percentages in Line Height variables. The values in this token are the result of multiplying the font size by the line height variable defined on the Bild home css -> newsTickerTime line height: 1.3. Line height for this component does not change across devices.

breadcrumbFontSize.description: 15 - 15 - 15 - 12 -- Breadcrumbs have a slightly larger font size on mobile devices compared to when they are rendered on larger desktop devices.

appAvatarFontFamily.description: This variable is used for setting the font of avatars on iOS and Android platforms. This is subject to review.

avatarLabelFontSize.description: This variable is used on avatar names in article pages. Bild: 16 - 16 - 16 - 18; SpoBi&Ads: 13 - 13 - 13 - 15

avatarLabelLineHeight.description: This variable is used for controlling the line height of avatar texts. Its values influence the stacking space between avatar texts. 21 - 21 - 21 - 23

stdTeaserKickerHeadlineStackSpace.description: 2 | 2 | 2 | 2 - This variable is used on the standard teaser vertical spacing between the kicker and the headline. It references the semantic variable stackSpaceConst3XS

quadHeadlineFontSize.description: This component level variable is used on the quad teaser headline. It references the semantic level variable headline1. 48 - 48 - 72 - 100

teaserBadgesMarginSpace.description: This variable is used for creating space around the outside of a subscription badge or video icon badge.

teaserBadgesHeightSizeLG.description: This token is for controling the height of badges that are inside of teasers. 32 - 32 - 32 - 40

partnerLinkButtonLabelFontSize.description: Use this variable for controlling the font size of partner buttons. 16 - 16 - 16 - 18

buttonContentMinHeightSize.description: This fixed height variable ensures that the button maintains a consistent height, even when the icon is not active.

videoTimeBadgeCornerSize.description: This variable is used on video player badges that display a red play icon on top of a white square next to a time stamp. This variable references the borderRadiusXS. Constant value of 2 across device sizes.

videoTimeBadgeFontSize.description: 16 - 16 - 18 - 18 -- This variable is used to control the videoTimeBadge text style's font size parameter. The typography style that uses this variable is the videoTimeBadge style. The badge that uses this variable appears on the upper right corner of horizontal videos.

videoTimeBadgeSize.description: 24 - 24 - 32 - 40 - This variable is used on horizontal video badges that contain a red play icon on top of a white square next to a timestamp.

videoRedPlayIconHeightSize.description: This variable is used for changing the red play icon inside the white square.

videoAdBadgeFontSize.description: 14 - 14 - 16 - 16 -- This variable is used in the videoAdBadge font size parameter.

galleryPaginationContainerWebInlineSpace.description: 8 - 8 - 12 - 12 - this component level variable references the inlineSpaceConst semantic variables; SM for smaller devices, MD for larger devices

galleryPaginationContainerStackSpace.description: 12 - 12 - 16 - 16 - this component level variable references the semantic

BadgesInnerStackSpace.description: This space variable is used for creating the top and bottom space between a badge's text label and the surface that the text label is on top of.

BadgesInnerInlineSpace.description: This space variable is used for creating the left and right space between a badge's text label and the badge background surface that the text label is on top of.

adLabelBadgeHeightSize.description: 30 - 30 - 30 - 30 - This variable is used on the Advert rectangular badge that is found above an ad containers.

sectionTitle&ArrowInlineSpace.description: This variable is used on large title headings that are h2 elements in html and indicate a new section in the user interface. This space changes when a user hovers over the large title.

sectionTitle&ArrowInlineSpaceActive.description: This variable is used for increasing the space between the text and the arrow at the end of the large title text. On mobile devices there is no hover state so this variables values are the same as the default state values.

audioPlayerFontSize.description: This variable is used in the text style dedicated to audio player labels for elapsed time, reproduction speed and short functionality description text. 16 - 16 - 16 - 18

chipsFontSize.description: This variable is used on the chips font size parameter of the chips text style. The font size changes only for the change between larger device widths and any device smaller than the largest. 16 - 16 -16 - 18

tabLabelFontSize.description: Tab labels font size remain constant at 16px across devices and breakpoints. This behavior can be seen on the Mein Konto page tabs for purchases and payment data.

tabLabelFontSizeLine.description: Tab labels font size remain constant at 16px across devices and breakpoints. This behavior can be seen on the Mein Konto page tabs for purchases and payment data.

appsTabsLabelFontSize.description: Tab labels font size remain constant at 16px across devices and breakpoints. This behavior can be seen on the Mein Konto page tabs for purchases and payment data.

appsTabsLabelLineHeight.description: Tab labels font size remain constant at 16px across devices and breakpoints. This behavior can be seen on the Mein Konto page tabs for purchases and payment data.

galleryTeaserTitleBottomSpace.description: This token is used to create more bottom padding space on system teaser headlines inside the gallery to avoid overlapping with the pagination.

galleryTeaserAppGapSpace.description: This token is used to create more bottom padding space on system teaser headlines inside the gallery to avoid overlapping with the pagination.

paywallCardPriceTagFontSize.description: This variable is used on the paywall card price tag. 64 constant

paywallCardPriceNoteFontSize.description: This variable is used on the paywall card text under the price tag. 40 - 40 - 40 - 40

appToggleItemLabelFontSize.description: This variable is used on labels in list items with toggle switches found in app preferences. 14 - 14 - 16 - 18

changeOnMD.description: This variable is used for controlling size changes across device sizes on some components such as the vertical newsticker cards and the search results cards. Both have cards that change layouts at different breakpoints.

bodyFontSize.description: This variable is used on the body text style's font size parameter. It remains constant at 21.

label2FontSize.description: This variable controls the label2 text style's font size parameter. Its value remains constant at 15.

label4FontSize.description: This token is used in the font size parameter of the label4 text style. The value remains constant at 8.

callout1FontSize.description: This token is used for the font size parameter of the callout text style. 18 - 18 - 22 - 22

Kicker2FontSize.description: Values come from comparing NMT Figma File 01_Foundation to online CSS. Online kickers are numbered from 0 to 3. This DS uses 1 to 4 following html convention of h1, h2, h3, etc. 18 - 18 - 22 - 24

Kicker3FontSize.description: Values come from comparing NMT Figma File 01_Foundation to online CSS. Online kickers are numbered from 0 to 3. 16 - 16 - 18 - 20

quoteFontSize.description: 16 - 16 - 18 - 20 -- This variable is used for controlling the font size of the quote text style.

label1LineHeight.description: This variable is used in the label1 text style's line height parameter. It references branding variables for brand specific line heights.

quoteLineHeight.description: This variable is used in the quote text style line height parameter.

menuItemFontSize.description: This variable is used on the menu link lane and on the mobile side menu drawer.

The values in this token are the result of multiplying the font size by the line height variable defined on the Bild home css -> newsTickerTime line height: 1.3. Line height for this component does not change across devices.

BadgesInnerStackSpace.description: This space variable is used for creating the top and bottom space between a badge's text label and the surface that the text label is on top of.

BadgesInnerInlineSpace.description: This space variable is used for creating the left and right space between a badge's text label and the badge background surface that the text label is on top of.

adLabelBadgeHeightSize.description: 30 - 30 - 30 - 30 - This variable is used on the Advert rectangular badge that is found above an ad containers.

sectionTitle&ArrowInlineSpace.description: This variable is used on large title headings that are h2 elements in html and indicate a new section in the user interface. This space changes when a user hovers over the large title.

sectionTitle&ArrowInlineSpaceActive.description: This variable is used for increasing the space between the text and the arrow at the end of the large title text. On mobile devices there is no hover state so this variables values are the same as the default state values.

audioPlayerFontSize.description: This variable is used in the text style dedicated to audio player labels for elapsed time, reproduction speed and short functionality description text. 16 - 16 - 16 - 18

chipsFontSize.description: This variable is used on the chips font size parameter of the chips text style. The font size changes only for the change between larger device widths and any device smaller than the largest. 16 - 16 -16 - 18

tabLabelFontSize.description: Tab labels font size remain constant at 16px across devices and breakpoints. This behavior can be seen on the Mein Konto page tabs for purchases and payment data.

tabLabelFontSizeLine.description: Tab labels font size remain constant at 16px across devices and breakpoints. This behavior can be seen on the Mein Konto page tabs for purchases and payment data.

appsTabsLabelFontSize.description: Tab labels font size remain constant at 16px across devices and breakpoints. This behavior can be seen on the Mein Konto page tabs for purchases and payment data.

appsTabsLabelLineHeight.description: Tab labels font size remain constant at 16px across devices and breakpoints. This behavior can be seen on the Mein Konto page tabs for purchases and payment data.

galleryTeaserTitleBottomSpace.description: This token is used to create more bottom padding space on system teaser headlines inside the gallery to avoid overlapping with the pagination.

galleryTeaserAppGapSpace.description: This token is used to create more bottom padding space on system teaser headlines inside the gallery to avoid overlapping with the pagination.

paywallCardPriceTagFontSize.description: This variable is used on the paywall card price tag. 64 constant

paywallCardPriceNoteFontSize.description: This variable is used on the paywall card text under the price tag. 40 - 40 - 40 - 40

appToggleItemLabelFontSize.description: This variable is used on labels in list items with toggle switches found in app preferences. 14 - 14 - 16 - 18

appToggleItemLabelLineHeight.description: This variable is used on labels in list items with toggle switches found in app preferences. 14.1 - 14.1 - 16.2 - 18.2

visilbleMobileOnly.description: Use for showing elements on mobile viewport sizes only

visilbleDesktopOnly.description: Use for showing elements on desktop viewport sizes only

visilbleAbove600px.description: Use for showing elements on viewport sizes above 600 px

visilbleBelow600px.description: Use for showing elements on viewport sizes below 600 px

hideOnMobile.description: Use for hiding elements on mobile viewport sizes

visilbleTabletOnly.description: Use for showing elements on tablet viewport sizes only

hideOnDesktop.description: Use for hiding elements on desktop viewport sizes only

changeOnMD.description: This variable is used for controlling size changes across device sizes on some components such as the vertical newsticker cards and the search results cards. Both have cards that change layouts at different breakpoints.

bodyFontFamily.description: This variable references the bodyFontFamily variable from the branding collection.

headline1FontWeightST.description: This variable is a string type variable for controlling not only headline font weight but also the italic style for Sport Bild headlines.

Display1FontSize.description: This variable is used on the font size parameter for the display1 text style. 40 - 40 - 72 - 120

Display2FontSize.description: This variable is used for the font size parameter of the Display2 text style. 36 - 36 - 42 - 64

Display3FontSize.description: This variable is used on the display3 font size parameter of the display3 text style. 28 - 28 - 32 - 40

Headline1FontSize.description: This token is used for the headline1 text style's font size parameter. 48 - 48 - 72 - 100

Headline2FontSize.description: This token is used on the headline2 text style's font size parameter. 40 - 40 - 48 - 64

Headline3FontSize.description: This token is used on the headline3 text style's font size parameter. 28 - 28 - 36 - 40

Headline4FontSize.description: This token controls the headline4 text style's font size parameter: 22 - 22 - 26 - 32

bodyFontSize.description: This variable is used on the body text style's font size parameter. It remains constant at 21.

label3FontSize.description: This token is used in the label3 text style's font size parameter. Its value remains constant at 12 across device sizes.

label2FontSize.description: This variable controls the label2 text style's font size parameter. Its value remains constant at 15.

label1FontSize.description: This token is used in the label1 text style font size parameter. Its value remains constant at 17 across device sizes.

label1FontSizeResponsive.description: 10 - 10 - 15 - 17 Use this label font size when you want your label's font size to change across device sizes.

label4FontSize.description: This token is used in the font size parameter of the label4 text style. The value remains constant at 8.

callout1FontSize.description: This token is used for the font size parameter of the callout text style. 18 - 18 - 22 - 22

footnote1FontSize.description: This token is used on the footnote text style font size parameter. 16 - 16 - 16 - 18

footnote2FontSize.description: This token is used in the font size parameter of the footnote2 text style. 12 - 12 - 12 - 16

Kicker1FontSize.description: Values come from NMT Figma File 01_Foundation; in online CSS this is kicker0. 18 - 18 - 22 - 30 - This variable does not exist yet in online css. Online css is called kicker0 for smallest font size.

Kicker2FontSize.description: Values come from comparing NMT Figma File 01_Foundation to online CSS. Online kickers are numbered from 0 to 3. This DS uses 1 to 4 following html convention of h1, h2, h3, etc. 18 - 18 - 22 - 24

Kicker3FontSize.description: Values come from comparing NMT Figma File 01_Foundation to online CSS. Online kickers are numbered from 0 to 3. 16 - 16 - 18 - 20

Kicker4FontSize.description: Values come from comparing NMT Figma File 01_Foundation to online CSS. Online kickers are numbered from 0 to 3. 14 - 14 - 16 - 16

subheadline1FontSize.description: This token controls the subheadline1 font size parameter. 24 - 24 - 32 - 36

quoteFontSize.description: 16 - 16 - 18 - 20 -- This variable is used for controlling the font size of the quote text style.

bodyLineHeight.description: Figma's font line height currently does not allow for multipliers as is used on current website css var(--body-line-height)

label1LineHeight.description: This variable is used in the label1 text style's line height parameter. It references branding variables for brand specific line heights.

quoteLineHeight.description: This variable is used in the quote text style line height parameter.

letterSpacingPositiveSM.description: 0.5 | 0.5 | 0.5 | 0.5 | This variable takes primitive letter spacing variables and creates this semantic variable for use on designs that change across device sizes.

letterSpacingPositiveLG.description: 2 | 2 | 2 | 3 | This variable takes primitive letter spacing variables and creates this semantic variable for use on designs that change across device sizes.

letterSpacingPositiveMD.description: 1 | 1 | 1 | 1 | This variable takes primitive letter spacing variables and creates this semantic variable for use on designs that change across device sizes.

letterSpacingNone.description: 0 | 0 | 0 | 0 | This variable takes primitive letter spacing variables and creates this semantic variable for use on designs that change across device sizes.

letterSpacingNegativeMD.description: -1 | -1 | -1 | -1 | This variable takes primitive letter spacing variables and creates this semantic variable for use on designs that change across device sizes.

letterSpacingNegativeLG.description: -2 | -2 | -2 | -3 | This variable takes primitive letter spacing variables and creates this semantic variable for use on designs that change across device sizes.

letterSpacingNegativeXS.description: -0.25 | -0.25 | -0.25 | -0.25 | This variable takes primitive letter spacing variables and creates this semantic variable for use on designs that change across device sizes. This letter spacing was only found in large titles on iOS mobile app large title component.

letterSpacingPositiveXS.description: 0.25 | 0.25 | 0.25 | 0.25 | This variable takes primitive letter spacing variables and creates this semantic variable for use on designs that change across device sizes.

display1LetterSpacing.description: -0.5 | -0.5 | -1 | -2 | This variable is used for the letter spacing parameter of the display1 text style. On smaller devices the value is smaller than on larger devices. On desktop devices the letter spacing is further reduced for making the text style more compact.

display2LetterSpacing.description: -0.5 | -0.5 | -1 | -1 | This variable is used for the letter spacing parameter of the display2 text style. On smaller devices the value is smaller than on larger devices.

display3LetterSpacing.description: -0.5 | -0.5 | -1 | -1 | This variable is used for the letter spacing parameter of the display3 text style. On smaller devices the value is smaller than on larger devices.
